headline: Daily Kos Elections Live Digest: 3/11
sentences:
Friday, Mar 11, 2022  10:19:18 AM Pacific Standard Time  Jeff Singer
OH-Sen: Rich guy Mike Gibbons' newest Republican primary ad attacks former state Treasurer Josh Mandel as a phony conservative, arguing he supported Al Gore, flipped flopped on abortion, gave tax breaks to Hollywood leftists, and used $2 million of your tax dollars to promote himself.?
That first charge is accompanied by 2000 footage of Mandel, who was undergraduate president at OSU at the time, with Gore during the vice president's visit to campus, video that became public in 2011 during Mandel's first failed bid for the Senate.

Sheldon, in his capacity as a commissioner, made news in 2009 when he argued that his well-armed constituents could withstand budget cuts for law enforcement and, in a statement directed at local criminals, declared, You're on notice: if you attempt a home-invasion robbery, you may be met with armed resistance and could receive a Mason County hot lead enema.? Sheldon in 2012 was also one of just three Democrats in the chamber to vote against legalizing same-sex marriage, a bill that passed with support from four Republicans.

Pat McCrory 31-25 in the May Republican primary, with former Rep. Mark Walker grabbing 16%; the memo said that an unreleased June poll gave McCrory a 45-31 edge, and it argued that the congressman has a lot of room to grow thanks to President Donald Trump's endorsement.?
Those numbers, though, may have been overshadowed by the over-the-top Budd press release accompanying them, which included the line, Politico [sniffs disdainfully and orders another cocktail at the country]: That can't be right.

Friday, Mar 11, 2022  8:33:32 AM Pacific Standard Time  Jeff Singer
IL-03: The first poll of the June Democratic primary comes from Lake Research Partners on behalf of state Rep. Delia Ramirez's allies at the Working Families Party, and it shows her leading Chicago Alderman Gilbert Villegas 19-11 with most respondents undecided; a mere 1% goes to Iymen Chehade, a history professor who is at the center of an ethics probe involving Rep. Marie Newman (who is running in the 6th District).

We have been ASSURED by some of the premier Establishmentarians in Washington that President Trump has zero juice in primaries anymore.?
 Friday, Mar 11, 2022  12:05:46 PM Pacific Standard Time  Jeff Singer
NE-Gov: University of Nebraska Regent Jim Pillen's new commercial for the May GOP primary stars Larry the Cable Guy, who at one point shouts out, Vote for Jimmy or you're a communist!? That's the joke.

Faulconer spent years as one of the only Republican rising stars in this dark blue state, but last September's recall campaign against Newsom saw him plummet hard to earth: Faulconer took a distant third place with just 8% in the race to replace Newsom, a question that didn't even end up mattering because a 62-38 majority voted against ousting the governor.

Friday, Mar 11, 2022  8:28:13 AM Pacific Standard Time  Jeff Singer
CA-09: While astronaut Jose Hernandez, who was the Democratic nominee in a very competitive 2012 race for the old 10th District, filed paperwork last month for a potential intra-party bid against Rep. Josh Harder, he announced Friday that he wouldn't run.

The senator, who is the longest-serving member of the legislature, has continued to caucus with the GOP even though his influence has plummeted since Team Blue won a Sheldon-proof majority through 2017: Democrats currently hold 28 of the 49 seats in the chamber, with Sheldon and the GOP controlling the remaining 21.

It was one month later, though, when Sheldon truly became a pariah within the Democratic Party when he and two other members, Rodney Tom and Jim Kastama, joined with the 23 Republicans to pass a budget during a special session, a move that effectively handed control of the chamber to the GOP minority.

And she has the gall to run for United State Senate.?
 Friday, Mar 11, 2022  10:59:48 AM Pacific Standard Time  David Nir
MO-Sen: When LL Cool J demanded, "Don't call it a comeback," he gave us good reason to believe him with the explosive success of his fourth studio album, "Mama Said Knock You Out."

The commercial declares that one of Putin's old oligarchs partnered with Jane Timken's family business to build high-capacity freight rail cars, supplying Putin's government with military-grade machinery.? The narrator continues, Timken's family gets rich, Timken money funds her campaign.

Friday, Mar 11, 2022  11:58:24 AM Pacific Standard Time  Jeff Singer
WA State Senate: Tim Sheldon, a nominal Democrat who spent much of the last decade keeping the Republican minority in charge of the Washington state Senate, announced Thursday that he would retire this year.

Sheldon was elected to the state House back in 1990 from a seat that contained his home of Mason County, a rural area in the western part of the state, and he won a promotion in a 1997 special election after he decisively unseated an appointed Democratic senator.

Friday, Mar 11, 2022  8:34:50 AM Pacific Standard Time  Jeff Singer
MI-03: EMILY's List has endorsed 2020 Democratic nominee Hillary Scholten, who faces no serious intra-party opposition as she seeks a rematch against Republican incumbent Peter Meijer.

Mandel did not actually endorse Gore, and Michael Kruse recently wrote in a long profile in Politico that Mandel celebrated, too, a visit to campus by Republican candidate John McCain.? Of course, that may be a far worse offense in today's GOP.

Sheldon, who concurrently served on the Mason County Board of County Commissioners from 2005 to 2017, spent years as one of the more conservative members of the Democratic caucus, and he even reportedly cast a ballot for George W. Bush.

Democrats still got a small measure of vengeance a few months later when they unanimously joined together to swap Republican Pam Roach, a hardline conservative who was on the outs with her own party, in as president pro tem.

It's possible that Sheldon's now-open seat, which would have supported Trump by a narrow 49-48, could replace him with an actual Democrat as well, though the party may have other races to focus on in a tough midterm year.

If anything, headlining a fundraising event is a much bigger deal than simply slapping your name on a press release announcing you're endorsing someone: One generates actual dollars, the other generates  a press release.

Dan McKee on Thursday picked up endorsements from two notable labor groups, the Rhode Island Building and Construction Trades Council and the Rhode Island Laborers' District Council, for the September Democratic primary.

The trio, wrote NPR, soon returned to the caucus room like nothing had happened, but mainstream Democrats were furious: One member was particularly pissed, saying, There are three Democrats who are holding us hostage.

The duo, who were next up for a four-year term in 2014, joined with Republicans to form an alliance called the Majority Coalition Caucus, which was essentially the West Coast version of New York's notorious IDC.

In November Democrat Manka Dhingra decisively won a special election to replace a late Republican senator, which gave her party the 25-24 Sheldon-proof majority it had coveted for the last five years.
Team Blue netted four more seats the following year, and while Sheldon defeated an actual Democrat 52-48 in a seat that Donald Trump had won 47-44 in 2016, his presence no longer mattered much.
Republicans picked up Kastama's seat that fall, and while Democrats maintained a 26-23 majority on paper, Sheldon and Tom made good on their threats to permanently bolt the caucus.
Parson hadn't previously weighed in on the contest, which includes a large cast of ambitious hopefuls and even one nightmare candidate that national Republicans are eager to block.

CA-Gov: Former San Diego Mayor Kevin Faulconer said Thursday evening that he wouldn't challenge Democratic Gov.
